document.title: FY24 Agricultural and Envrionmental Systems Career Field Content Standards

2BEB7DA5BCBC476D886BE7AC2EA10DE1.description: Identify symptoms of exposure to health-threatening environments (e.g., temperature; chemical noise, vibration, harshness [NVH] hazards).

13A64E4FE48C45F5B6B25D1D26428F2E.description: Describe the interactions of incompatible substances when measuring and mixing chemicals.

8D4304E3A89045929CF64A185A44C2DA.description: Select and operate fire extinguishers based on the class of fire.

14A62F531EA844349B2403673B5F4060.description: Identify the source of electrical hazards and use shutdown and established lock- out/tag-out procedures.

B9D4C293995042B49BFEDA2D4C86BBF9.description: Demonstrate the proper use of American National Standards Institute (ANSI) hand signals.

CE1D38EF39CC4D5C94115A6074BF3449.description: Apply inspection, rejection criteria, hitch configurations, and load handling practices to slings and rigging hardware.

E5E32112FD2148D7A98EF1135DFFEB15.description: Follow established procedures for the administration of first aid and contact emergency medical personnel when necessary.

A175EC567BFB45FBAEE26F27678D4727.description: Identify, inspect, and use safety equipment appropriate for the task.

DBB270468B094DC1AD6153EBD8E68594.description: Identify safety hazards and take corrective measures.

650AE99C226D47FDB414A7DB9DD6D980.description: Select, use, store, maintain, and dispose of personal protective equipment (PPE), appropriate to job tasks, conditions, and materials.

EDCE72C0DCB045288E7B9E946DC0D985.description: Identify procedures for the handling, storage, and disposal of hazardous materials.

85B50A98893E426AA63D1C9A556A9158.description: Identify the location of emergency flush showers, eyewash fountains, Safety Data Sheets (SDSs), fire alarms, and exits.

7196E3CD20AE442C8FAE9E7D957C7E8D.description: Describe how working under the influence of drugs and alcohol increases the risk of accident, lowers productivity, raises insurance costs, and reduces profits.

97E2189C295948CF9145700E04CACFAA.description: Interpret personal safety rights according to the employee Right to Know plan.

3B2820E7ECDB49EF9526BE7FBA1CA935.description: Use Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) defined procedures for identifying employer and employee responsibilities, working in confined spaces, managing worker safety programs, using ground fault circuit interrupters (GFCIs), maintaining clearance and boundaries, and labeling.

0BB2B2F3E4024E1EA327ED2313B93C1D.description: Site and Personal Safety Procedures: Follow site and personal safety procedures in specific situations with specialized tools and equipment, evaluate the situation, and take corrective action.

AD5493390C1A4A26AAAC923A438DDF1A.description: Describe how laws and regulations influence domestic and international trade.

37D800EDA7034373966340D8BEE9E96E.description: Identify the relationships between economy, society, and environment that lead to sustainability.

E311F89157414F12A8295E865C4AC049.description: Describe how economic performance and culture are interdependent.

1AA38497180D4DD0AE79F347C9EF692B.description: Explain how financial markets and government policies influence interest rates (credit ratings/debt ceiling), trade deficits, and unemployment.

C2A5FA3106864CDCB0F1C0906411CC17.description: Analyze factors that aﬀect currency and exchange rates.

AB658369A6904B68A694AF723B82210E.description: Determine how the quality, quantity, and pricing of goods and services are aﬀected by domestic and international competition in a market economy.

4BC6B0DE2BC9441CB1D6254B094CEE9B.description: Use economic indicators to identify economic trends and conditions (e.g., inflation, interest rate fluctuations, unemployment rates).

99BA94310EFA44D7AC6E17373AB8351B.description: Identify the diﬀerence between monetary and nonmonetary incentives and explain how changes in incentives cause changes in behavior.

D82245C57BD84193ABD92B59D0E6CDEA.description: Identify the economic principles that guide geographic location of an industry's facilities (e.g., relative scarcity, price, quantity of products and services).

4B1D6BEB99E44B9C81BB1CE1AD1C118E.description: Principles of Business Economics: Examine and employ economic principles, concepts, and policies to accomplish organizational goals and objectives.

2B7049A4E8514C6190051AC5DAC5CF97.description: Describe how product mix (e.g., product line, product items) maximizes sales revenues, market share, and profit margin.

6E54184208D1407389A256E5EC9B9360.description: Use promotional techniques to maximize sales revenues (e.g., advertising, sales promotions, publicity, public relations).

35E6A3CD03EC4A61A5BAEE8A45B4CCE3.description: Describe the importance and diversity of distribution channels (i.e., direct, indirect) to sell a product.

B08224B9FB634CE5ADD58B4D83B0FBDB.description: Discuss the importance of correct pricing to support a product’s or service’s positioning in the marketing mix.

469C1BCBAD344C0D851B27F22AE714E2.description: Monitor customer expectations and determine product/service satisfaction by using measurement tools.

1881DE95D4EF413F88F3FFAECA926FA6.description: Identify the company policies and procedures for initiating product and service improvements.

78E590DB76634D4FB8D020E54AE394C8.description: Communicate features, benefits, and warranties of a product or service to the customer.

998F22AADB9146A992EDA64879F22F6F.description: Determine the customer's needs and identify solutions.

58720BD89F6D450A9B1C43088C677AE6.description: Identify how the roles of sales, advertising, and public relations contribute to a company’s brand.

6631E26747504BCE97B06D244CC5CDD9.description: Sales and Marketing: Manage pricing, place, promotion, packaging, positioning, and public relations to improve quality customer service.

9875E90FC06F48FB8A65D434376C821F.description: Identify the role of depreciation in tax planning and liability.

039967627391409F83497901467677FB.description: Compare and contrast diﬀerent banking services available through financial institutions.

AA3EB8EF4FD34BA1AC6E8E6FD9E30FC0.description: Review and summarize categories (types) of insurance and identify how insurance can reduce financial risk.

7E74107B0D084BF7B0448387D3A8C753.description: Explain how credit ratings and the criteria lenders use to evaluate repayment capacity aﬀect access to loans.

BEB0F29B7A8A49ADA478115FE2347DDD.description: Identify ways to avoid or correct debt problems.

16DE59E114E048CAA16F4EB509B8DB1D.description: Identify credit types and their uses in order to establish credit.

0EA568D60C5242CDAF637A7904683C83.description: Review and summarize savings, investment strategies, and purchasing options (e.g., cash, lease, finance, stocks, bonds).

6D1CCFEF710B4AEA9CC3DD4C9DB3F956.description: Create, analyze, and interpret financial documents (e.g., budgets, income statements).

19D0C0C8D9AC45088865A1AC97743140.description: Financial Management: Use financial tools, strategies, and systems to develop, monitor, and control the use of financial resources to ensure personal and business financial well-being.

17B81AB58A994953AF2559BB12A99ACA.description: Analyze how business management and environmental management systems (e.g., health, safety) contribute to continuous improvement and sustainability.

B43B31A190C249B1A89F961D91432805.description: Develop a budget that reflects the strategies and goals of the organization.

231898C466534454B695F6257AC1B810.description: Identify routine activities for maintaining business facilities and equipment.

EFE6044FB3F14290BC85779EAD3574A0.description: Collect information and feedback to help assess the organization’s strategic planning and policymaking processes.

E6059C5EEBA146BB8859673F45372548.description: Identify the advantages and disadvantages of carrying cost and Just-in-Time (JIT) production systems and the eﬀects of maintaining inventory (e.g., perishable, shrinkage, insurance) on profitability.

BB853A8342CC4BCB99B335D9A571A0F5.description: Use inventory and control systems to purchase materials, supplies, and equipment (e.g., Last In, First Out [LIFO]; First In, First Out [FIFO]; Just in Time [JIT]; LEAN).

44E5284E8FD24BABB9A544180BD214D9.description: Identify alternative actions to take when goals are not met (e.g., changing goals, changing strategies, eﬀiciencies).

9E873BF4C98247C395D420A5097AA68E.description: Analyze the performance of organizational activities and reallocate resources to achieve established goals.

1AEB8C8F861C4642BDCC96D4A77FC110.description: Select and organize resources to develop a product or a service.

7D00761362714BA3A8469D4E60D5CE8C.description: Forecast future resources and budgetary needs using financial documents (e.g., balance sheet, demand forecasting, financial ratios).

62759F6E402147FD8C7EFAFF7BDCEC04.description: Operations Management: Plan, organize, and monitor an organization or department to maximize contribution to organizational goals and objectives.

C217E5DE81634F479B6374157CFE65F6.description: Protect intellectual property and knowledge (e.g., copyright, patent, trademark, trade secrets, processes).

1D6E964AF5E64224A39D2CFF7848AAF8.description: Identify resources available to entrepreneurs (e.g., Small Business Administration, mentors, information resources, educational opportunities).

001214903D40456B8F97B3B8F4E77493.description: Identify initial steps in establishing a business (e.g., limited liability company [LLC], tax ID, permits, insurance, licensing).

D04661F2A25E4FF98B076DF5F6257549.description: Describe techniques for obtaining experience (e.g., apprenticeship, co-operative [co- op] education, work placement, internship, job shadowing) related to an entrepreneurial objective.

DEB233AFCDF241F8A39EEAA076CF8A7D.description: Conduct a self-assessment to determine entrepreneurial potential.

5557824BE6FA4CDEA1C4B7CD22515C22.description: Explain pathways used to become an entrepreneur.

AE72B408F7314D00BB1F426226709EA3.description: Create a list of personal strengths, weaknesses, skills, and abilities needed to be successful as an entrepreneur.

3EA3A93DE2534CACB8FD136884407CAB.description: Describe life cycles of an entrepreneurial business and an entrepreneur.

245DE61F346A4EFA91FED24A23A0FBB9.description: Assess the roles of nonprofit and for-profit businesses.

90D048ACBEBE47ECAA529519781B2CDE.description: Identify the factors that contribute to the success and failure of entrepreneurial ventures.

7A983CFBBFF648D1B1F031BF112FC134.description: Explain the role of profit as the incentive to entrepreneurs in a market economy.

BC9785C0D9044C2BA2FA1428127E96D7.description: Compare and contrast the four types of business ownership (i.e., individual proprietorships, partnerships, corporations, cooperatives).

F63CCFE90C0B4F9F85FFE7A4FB33E3E0.description: Entrepreneurship/Entrepreneurs: Analyze the environment in which a business operates, and the economic factors and opportunities associated with self-employment.

A33707E495E940568DDDAA42CE474622.description: Describe classifications of employee benefits, rights, deductions, and compensations.

74D5FCEFD6BE47EA8C093CD0B307613C.description: Describe how all business activities of an organization work within the parameters of a budget.

A4039E0A894A40F88AA51C3D26A2BAF2.description: Describe the impact of globalization on an enterprise or organization.

B12D62557A354E2B89CE5001B3E3E8B3.description: Explain how the performance of an employee, a department, and an organization are assessed.

4122D1440EF244BFAEF77CF606A2DCAC.description: Identify the features and benefits that make an organization’s product or service competitive.

412D33306DF8413F93C3AD724C288F14.description: Identify the eﬀect of supply and demand on products and services.

73B67486999240D1B146687AB0386034.description: Identify the target market served by the organization, the niche that the organization fills, and an outlook of the industry.

FCE3C11C559A45DFB5E4D318CE357F7D.description: Describe organizational structure, chain of command, the roles and responsibilities of the organizational departments, and interdepartmental interactions.

0E6A5CB6EEE14E289635F4933585D112.description: Identify types of businesses, ownership, and entities (i.e., individual proprietorships, partnerships, corporations, cooperatives, public, private, profit, not-for-profit).

2B7D662B95184B0B9EE6CD6E77040284.description: Explain the importance of planning your business.

10B61CF518DA4677AF959D65699D2DB2.description: Assess the reality of becoming an entrepreneur, including advantages and disadvantages (e.g., risk versus reward, reasons for success and failure).

896A63DC17B24C988BD29C6E550E912B.description: Business Literacy: Develop foundational skills and knowledge in entrepreneurship, financial literacy, and business operations.

859696703AC347708E6363F2A0D665AE.description: Identify how multicultural teaming and globalization can foster development of new and improved products and services and recognition of new opportunities.

D4D7CAA1A99144FC88A8A024D44D2B5F.description: Use intercultural communication skills to exchange ideas and create meaning.

36A76A19A5C54494B283D94731D1D5CF.description: Analyze work tasks for understanding and interpretation from a diﬀerent cultural perspective.

3A43959C48104F53AD019C3653BD33A0.description: Recognize the ways in which bias and discrimination may influence productivity and profitability.

E34C0A883D3344109874C2E9005C81A6.description: Recognize barriers in cross-cultural relationships and implement behavioral adjustments.

E053033F8B16486EA61CEAD2C03BCF64.description: Use cultural intelligence to interact with individuals from diverse cultural settings.

7855C6429E924F7FA2D06E368EE6EC31.description: Describe how cultural intelligence skills influence the overall success and survival of an organization.

DD0F49C8AA6A4A9286DD3F53546DBC62.description: Describe how cultural understanding, cultural intelligence skills, and continual awareness are interdependent.

64F68FA43D2A4BFFAFCA1453FFE71E2E.description: Global Environment: Evaluate how beliefs, values, attitudes, and behaviors influence organizational strategies and goals.

718FF562AA6D4657BEBA4C1C6EF25F5C.description: Use electronic media to communicate and follow network etiquette guidelines.

8B1123495EEF466189BA2C945723348B.description: Use personal information management and productivity applications to optimize assigned tasks (e.g., lists, calendars, address books).

FFD1DFB5C2274140B0B0E35E4C936E4B.description: Use an electronic database to access and create business and technical information.

7CCE4193631645019777E65C8BD1778F.description: Use information technology tools to maintain, secure, and monitor business records.

26C4952866564B61ADF718E4BB76CE3F.description: Use system hardware to support software applications.

3D14BC56AD464E43AB238EE456D9407A.description: Verify compliance with security rules, regulations, and codes (e.g., property, privacy, access, accuracy issues, client and patient record confidentiality) pertaining to technology specific to the industry pathway.

DCBAF077E9AF4F68AD62E5B7142393D0.description: Select and use software applications to locate, record, analyze, and present information (e.g., word processing, e-mail, spreadsheet, databases, presentation, Internet search engines).

091468BF58704824B0CB881D2736977A.description: Use oﬀice equipment to communicate (e.g., phone, radio equipment, fax machine, scanner, public address systems).

BD5822C3FE824087B6F403126A09798F.description: Knowledge Management and Information Technology: Demonstrate current and emerging strategies and technologies used to collect, analyze, record, and share information in business operations.

789D43DAFDD047248906BA8E9785E248.description: Identify potential conflicts of interest (e.g., personal gain, project bidding) between personal, organizational, and professional ethical standards.

E6AF983E8B3A4933AECAD75C33011E9C.description: Verify compliance with computer and intellectual property laws and regulations.

8773F9E1DAFF420E93141C845F43F4C7.description: Identify the labor laws that aﬀect employment and the consequences of noncompliance for both employee and employer (e.g., harassment, labor, employment, employment interview, testing, minor labor laws, Americans with Disabilities Act, Fair Labor Standards Acts, Equal Employment Opportunity Commission [EEOC]).

6B39BDF38C6B4709B8C0B3A3BCFE8434.description: Identify deceptive practices (e.g., bait and switch, identity theft, unlawful door-to-door sales, deceptive service estimates, fraudulent misrepresentations) and their overall impact on organizational performance.

79F602368F0A439EAADA2866C25A4010.description: Access and implement safety compliance measures (e.g., quality assurance information, safety data sheets [SDSs], product safety data sheets [PSDSs], United States Environmental Protection Agency [EPA], United States Occupational Safety and Health Administration [OSHA]) that contribute to the continuous improvement of the organization.

4A79B98F6A5B4D19BC0E64CBAFC12AB6.description: Identify how federal and state consumer protection laws aﬀect products and services.

D93FFE3BD0AD4D17A84FF1613185CFDA.description: Use ethical character traits consistent with workplace standards (e.g., honesty, personal integrity, compassion, justice).

0781F878A5754DE6A448C5D75B76DD23.description: Follow protocols and practices necessary to maintain a clean, safe, and healthy work environment.

1C8A6BF514C3454299FF97928BEAE270.description: Analyze how regulatory compliance (e.g., United States Department of Agriculture [USDA], Food and Drug Administration [FDA], United States Department of Interior [USDI], Ohio Livestock Care Standards, water quality standards, local water regulations, building codes) aﬀects business operations and organizational performance.

835C111A9F6C45438D66586060B582CC.description: Business Ethics and Law: Analyze how professional, ethical, and legal behavior contributes to continuous improvement in organizational performance and regulatory compliance.

D49A42BBAA9142618C5FF56871D0FEBC.description: Use motivational strategies to accomplish goals.

019E81E27F9944D9A0B843F24B388A53.description: Identify stakeholders and solicit their opinions.

B09073A1AD1140CCA28BDBC573FC1119.description: Use technical writing skills to complete forms and create reports.

54BE5E234F6F441BA66B9B6572A174B1.description: Write professional correspondence, documents, job applications, and resumés.

C91A7E0602914EB281AA194B2153F555.description: Use interpersonal skills to provide group leadership, promote collaboration, and work in a team.

15CE16D65CE3492B84D0DCCEDFC18F67.description: Identify advantages and disadvantages involving digital and/or electronic communications (e.g., common content for large audience, control of tone, speed, cost, lack of non-verbal cues, potential for forwarding information, longevity).

CCEE3F29CEE549B3B92EEFD7CE9BD9DB.description: Identify the strengths, weaknesses, and characteristics of leadership styles that influence internal and external workplace relationships.

3B75AA8B66DB4C1C9DD0367B89F3A898.description: Use problem-solving and consensus-building techniques to draw conclusions and determine next steps.

776DDE6A85064C06A300AFB50450B166.description: Use proper grammar and expression in all aspects of communication.

D9526A8904514D8B8E2AB2576A861528.description: Communicate information (e.g., directions, ideas, vision, workplace expectations) for an intended audience and purpose.

1FEA8D240DDE417A88150BB40AF927BB.description: Use negotiation and conflict-resolution skills to reach solutions.

147B30A7534B44A7A96C1670A36E93A4.description: Identify and use verbal, nonverbal, and active listening skills to communicate eﬀectively.

DF5E99B6EFCE42A49C025206B66363E5.description: Extract relevant, valid information from materials and cite sources of information.

4895244A7BA746E3810211DA7A974164.description: Leadership and Communication: Process, maintain, evaluate, and disseminate information in a business. Develop leadership and team building to promote collaboration.

A704CB664ABB4E53B6C0532FB2BAA0CB.description: Identify healthy lifestyles that reduce the risk of chronic disease, unsafe habits, and abusive behavior.

848D2FDC53714758BCCEE993BFDA0A84.description: Recognize diﬀerent cultural beliefs and practices in the workplace and demonstrate respect for them.

D391FB2C147C48F9B10EF8DDDC561B3F.description: Adapt personal coping skills to adjust to taxing workplace demands.

DD9472124100429B9C640BE47756DC75.description: Give and receive constructive feedback to improve work habits.

DB9544A1F10441F4A997B48CA88035CE.description: Identify the correlation between emotions, behavior, and appearance and manage those to establish and maintain professionalism.

530E7E73D2FE44209616E6E7A3B1C0F0.description: Apply problem-solving and critical-thinking skills to work-related issues when making decisions and formulating solutions.

5A3FDD965FA3467FBF4BD0C270BFA37C.description: Explain the importance of work ethic, accountability, and responsibility and demonstrate associated behaviors in fulfilling personal, community, and workplace roles.

D9273DC1EDEB4B3FB61F2BC91FE03EA6.description: Develop strategies for self-promotion in the hiring process (e.g., filling out job applications, resumé writing, interviewing skills, portfolio development).

4E7B28F34A8E4446969E80A670B1D774.description: Describe the role and function of professional organizations, industry associations, and organized labor and use networking techniques to develop and maintain professional relationships.

F868EFD65CB0477BBCE2A4B36F985AF4.description: Develop a career plan that reflects career interests, pathways, and secondary and postsecondary options.

2544DC47BE414539AA0345986FA496AA.description: Identify the scope of career opportunities and the requirements for education, training, certification, licensure, and experience.

005C2F5FD47C4EDFBB90D00CEB309431.description: Identify the knowledge, skills, and abilities necessary to succeed in careers.

5A23F472372D4B2AB7E93AED8ED75F1F.description: Employability Skills: Develop career awareness and employability skills (e.g., face-to-face, online) needed for gaining and maintaining employment in diverse business settings.
